thread.title: UNG men's soccer blanks Clayton State, 1-0
thread.title_full: UNG men's soccer blanks Clayton State, 1-0

author: UNG Sports Communications
title: UNG men's soccer blanks Clayton State, 1-0
text:
Thursday October 15th, 2015 12:40PM Posted 11:09PM on Wednesday 14th October 2015 ( 13 hours ago ) UNG men's soccer blanks Clayton State, 1-0 By UNG Sports Communications Related Articles 
MORROW — The University of North Georgia men's soccer team made a first half goal by Ivan Acimovic stand up as the Nighthawks posted a 1-0 Peach Belt Conference win over Clayton State on Wednesday evening at CSU's Laker Field. 
Acimovic found the back of the net in the match's 17th minute marking the contest's only score. 
Victor Ohlin earned his third win of the year in goal with the 11-save shutout. 
The win is North Georgia's second consecutive and pushes the Nighthawks' record to 3-8-1 overall and 2-3-0 in league play. Clayton State falls to 6-4-1, 2-3-0 PBC. Associated Tags : UNG men's soccer © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com If anyone has been wondering if the hype surrounding Lanier senior defensive end Derrick Brown has been overblown, consider these numbers... 5:15PM ( 4 hours from now ) For the first time in a decade, the Atlanta Falcons have an opportunity to relegate their longtime rivals in New Orleans to early-season irrelevance. 12:15PM ( 25 minutes ago ) Joey Logano made a statement in Sunday's NASCAR Sprint Cup Series race at Charlotte Motor Speedway - he and Team Penske will be major players in the Chase for the Sprint Cup. 12:00PM ( 40 minutes ago ) Completing a tough three game swing in conference play, the Piedmont College women's soccer team was forced to settle for a scoreless draw on Wednesday evening against visiting USA South foe Maryville College. 11:06PM ( 13 hours ago ) Returning a roster full of talent including three starters and the USA South Rookie of the Year from 2014-15, the Piedmont College men's basketball team was picked in a tie for fifth place in the conference preseason coaches poll. 11:03PM ( 13 hours ago ) Georgia is clinging to slim hopes of winning the SEC East after falling out of the Top 25 with two straight losses and seeing star tailback Nick Chubb's season end with a knee injury. 10:13AM ( 1 day ago )
